Reviews.Title: “Novotel Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Peter726 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything was just great. Special highlight: the buffet breakfast, which, provided you book it as part of a deal, is fantastic value for money.

Reviews.Title: “New facility very good location”
Reviews.Author: amby1891
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Novotel Barcelona on April 2012. We were a family of 4, two adults and two teenagers. The stay was very good. We took the Novotel family package that allows getting 2 rooms at a reduced price. The hotel location is excellent. Not in the crowded middle of town, but yet very close to a metro station (line 1) with very easy access to all city attractions. The rooms looked new and clean. We stayed at the 7th floor, and besides the fact that in the mornings the elevators tend to be very crowded and the wait to go down tends to get long, we were happy with our rooms. The breakfast buffet was excellent! It includes real coffee machines, an omelet cook that will cook your omelet of choice, and the jewel of the crown fresh breads and pastries just out of the over, The baguettes and croissants are as good as the ones in France and other prime Europe locations. To top it off, kids under 16 eat free so that the cost is very reasonable also. The pool at the roof the hotel seems very nice. It was too cold to experience but I am sure that in summer the pool is a significant attraction. Opposite of the hotel is a big shopping center with a huge supermarket. We used it a lot for some of our lunch and dinners. Overall a very good experience. If we get to Barcelona again, I'll be sure to go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveBM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my wife. Our room was clean and light but not particularly big. This was fine as we were only using this as a base for exploring We arrived using the RENF and Metro service from the airport, to Cort and then onto Glories. The hotel is a short walk from the Metro. Opposite the hotel is a Tram stop on line T4 which was also handy for getting about. Opposite the hotel is a shopping centre with a large Carrefour, Starbucks and various other shops and restaurants. We used the Carrefour to buy breakfast supplies and breakfast was expensive, and very busy (we travelled during the Easter holidays) On the first night we used the hotel restaurant and sampled the 22 Euro buffet which was actually pretty good. The hotel staff were helpful and polite and the general ambiance is that of a busy city centre hotel. There is a small gym and pool on the roof which is pretty good but sadly despite our best intentions we didn't have time to use. Too much sightseeing and sleeping to do! I'd stay again for a functional hotel within easy reach of all the sights, but not right inside the tourist district.

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel, great location, free internet - perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Nandu T
Reviews.Content: Novotel Barcelona is one of the very best hotels I've stayed at. It is a modern hotel, and the internal decor was to a very high standard - more boutique, than business. The porcelain shone, and I sampled both the bath - deep and luxurious - and shower - strong, if not exactly a power shower, but a a little unpredictable on temperature - ranging from lovely and hot to tepid, from minute to minute. The free internet (accessed by a code supplied by reception) was super-speedy - a joy, compared with my fairly fast home broadband. Breakfast was hearty enough for all tastes, ranging from continental to full American/British. I also had dinner one night - the restaurant was swish, the service impeccable, and obliging, and the food good, if not outstanding. For business or pleasure, the Novotel Barcelona City won't disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but skip the bar”
Reviews.Author: MyGosha
Reviews.Content: New hotel, good Novotel standarts inside, stuff helpful, breakfast very good, everything fresh and good selection. You can walk to Sagrada Familia and I had a room with Sagrada views - spectacular. Torre Agbar is next to the hotel and looks dramatically at night with cobalt blue and red lights. Close to transport and across the street from rather good shopping centre with biiig Zara :-) Skip the bar, it closes early and girl is disappearing every time she makes 1 drink. She refused to make me a coctail 15 minutes before they close the bar (because they close in 15 minutes it was the response and mine was that she still has 15 minutes to make my coctail then, she was very unhappy but she made it). Big minus because of the bar but overall good hotel with free intenet access.

Reviews.Title: “City brake in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: DoruP
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights over the weekend in March 2012. First impression: we took a taxi from aeroport to hotel and cost us 30 euros! But at the hotel, the staff on front desk changed our bad impression - very helpful and friendly. We were staying in a suite and its looks very modern, new and comfortable (also very clean). There's free wi-fi in the rooms, access code you will get from the front desk. Our suite was located on the corner with a beautiful view towards the Torre Agbar. Breakfast was very consistent, with Spanish specialties, Hamon, eggs, ham, corizo , cheese, several kinds of jam, fruit and coffee. The hotel it's not far from the Sagrada Familia, aprox 15-20 minute walk. The bus from Barcelona City Tour (hop on, hop off tour bus) does stop right outside. We used this tour bus and was very affordable. Ticket price for one day is 24 euros / adult. We have had a great time here, and we will certainly return. And we recomand this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Overall 7 out of 10 - highs and lows”
Reviews.Author: GromitDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 2012. Plus points: The hotel is just a few minutes walk from Clot station which is where the train from the airport drops you, so it's handy for getting in and out of the city. It's not far from the sagrada familia, maybe a 15 minute walk and is near the glories metro station and some tram lines There's a very large supermarket and shopping centre just down the road and some cafes The staff seemed nice and were helpful The room we got (on the 18th floor) had great views of the city The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean and had a good shower Wifi is free Minus points Some of the worst pillows I have ever slept on The roof terrace pool was closed even though it was warm and sunny enough that I got sunburnt. The jacuzzi was empty (i.e. no water in it). The roof terrace bar was closed, and all the lights were turned off, even though guests were buying drinks at the bar downstairs and going up in the lift to the roof and sitting up there. Breakfast was €18 per person for the buffet. I had gotten a room rate only, as most of the time, I don't want a big breakfast so don't want to pay for it. However, there might be one occasion during my trip that I would like the hotel breakfast. Not at €18 though, particularly for a buffet (i.e. making my breakfast myself). No actual glasses or cups provided, just paper cups for tea and plastic cups wrapped in plastic wrapping for water, which is a waste of plastic. So, 7 out of 10 which I am rounding to 4 out of 5! Not the most central hotel, but it seems a bit cheaper than those that are more central. On balance I think Novotel is a good choice on that basis.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: missmaya24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast had a good variety from traditional Spanish dishes to pancakes to pastries. Skip the bar. The bartender poured us a drink then took off. The rooms are very modern and comfortable. There's free wi-fi in the rooms too. An important thing to note is major construction is in progress across the street and doesn't look like it'll be done anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Reviews. . .Recommended Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: FitDude
Reviews.Content: Except for its distance from Las Ramblas (10-15 minutes via Metro), it is difficult to say anything negative about my 3 day stay this hotel, and even its location is not a major problem. As is typical with this mid-level chain (its lower end sister hotel Ibis is just down the street), my “queen bed with sofa” room on the 11th floor was clean and modern, and somewhat larger than the average European hotel room, particularly the bathroom, although the open shower design did manage to still leave water on the floor, albeit not as much as my flood experience at the Novotel Zurich Airport. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet and cleaned promptly each day regardless of when I left. The TV had plenty of channels, and TV sound in the bathroom was nice, as was the power window shade operated from bedside controls. Free in room Wi-Fi was appreciated, but too slow to watch video or make a Skype call, although fine for e-mail and web surfing. Wi-Fi in the lobby had faster speeds. The roof-top gym was modern but only marginally equipped with well maintained machines, and includes a dry sauna and sun deck overlooking the city. The hotel is located directly across from a large shopping mall which includes a supermarket. The Glories Metro station is just over a block away, where you can get to virtually anywhere in central Barcelona in 20 minutes or less. The staff was efficient and responsive. I would strongly recommend this hotel which was reasonably priced at 75 euros/night, although not the breakfast at 18 euros/person.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: GioVale20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Barcelona City for one night in March. The hotel is located just a few minutes from the Metro Stop "Glories" from where you can reach the Rambla or Placa de Catalunya in just a few minutes. The hotel is very modern and delivers what you expect from a Novotel (i.e. modern, clean and functional infrastructure). Even though we checked-in at 10am already, we were given a room. The reception staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Our room was of medium size and very clean. The bathroom was one of the best I saw in my travels. The following morning we ate breakfast, which was really good with a nice mixture of pastries, cheese, meats, yogurt, etc. All in all a very pleasant experience and we would go back anytime. The price-quality ratio was excellent (we paid EUR 111 for the night including breakfast for two).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: PiperToronto
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a trip to Spain and stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. I love the location - it's close enough to the main sights (4 metro stops on the L1 line to Catalunya - no transfers) and from there you can walk down La Ramblas or walk north along Passeig de Gracia to visit Casa Battlo and/or Casa Mila. I also walked to Sagrada Familia from the hotel one morning - it took approx. 20 mins. There is a shopping mall right across the street but there's not a lot of shops there...I went there to pick up necessities and some snacks/drinks at the large supermarket and there was also a Japanese buffet restuarant that was a bargain - 8.95 Euros for lunch during the weekdays and approx. 13 Euros for dinner. As for the hotel, I found it very clean and modern. My room was on the 18th floor. It must be soundproof as I barely heard a pin drop outside the door. The bathroom was very spacious. Only complaint was the lack of a shower door so it everytime you took a shower, the floor was wet but that was easily fixed by asking for an extra bath towel to mop up the excess water. Lots of counter room to put all your various toiletries. The pull-out couch was very uncomfortable though...I woke up every hour my first night as my back and neck was aching so much but I think I got used to it because I didn't have any aches and pains after that. The usual amenities were provided such as a safe, flat screen tv, kettle with tea and coffee, etc. One thing I should mention is that lack of wi-fi connection...it is free but the connection was bad and the signal kept on dropping..sometimes you can get in, sometimes not...it was very frustrating...it could be due to the fact that I was on the 18th floor which is the second highest floor. Overall, I was very pleased with this hotel. If I am ever back in Barcelona, I will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bluehill
Reviews.Content: Visited on a business trip. Nice place to stay. Modern, well equipped, just what you need.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Sam A
Reviews.Content: Easy to reach hotel and well located. Staying for 3 nights.Nice walking area. Internet connection should be much faster by today standards. Hope to visit soon.

Reviews.Title: “Well located helpful staff great choice”
Reviews.Author: southcoasttraveller
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights in March. Found hotel by chance on internet - what a great choice. Well located - 3 mins walk to Metro. Staff could not do enough to help and gave some great advice. Room overlooking all of Barcelona - suggest you ask for this side? Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “novotel hotel barcelona spain”
Reviews.Author: patap186428
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here at the end of February. We Found the staff in reception and dining room to be very helpful. The hotel is close to metro station and we found it very easy to travel around using the metro and also very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good business hotel with excellent wifi and working areas. Out of the way for tourists though with very little to see and do in the surrounding area. Waiter in restaurant seemed uninterested after I had elected to sit alone at a 4 person table under a light (for reading) rather than the dingy corner he wanted to put me in. Otherwise, excellent

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, comfortable & clean rooms, can't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: HOLIDAYoholic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the 10th-13th February and couldn't fault it. We found it to be in a good location near the Glories Metro stop which allowed us to travel easily anywhere in the city, and taxis also stop directly outside the hotel. The Hotel was very clean and tidy, both in the reception and bar area, as well as in our room. The bed was comfortable and cleaned daily by the chamber maids. The bathroom was spotless and our room had a flat screen tv and plenty of power sockets. Me and my partner also went up to the roof (just to sneak a look) and although too cold in February to use the pool, I can say that both the pool and gym looked very nice on first appearance (we did not actually use either of these though). We did eat in the restaurant only once for an evening meal, this was only ok. It was nothing out of the ordinary and service was a little slow, however the food was satisfactory and the staff were polite. I would still however say there are better places to eat in Barcelona outside the hotel. I did spend a lot of time at the hotel bar, and although a little pricy for drinks, it was comfortable and not stuffy at all. I also noticed (although did not use) that they had PC's near the bar available for use (should you not have your laptop with you). Wifi at the hotel was also free, I did use this on my mobile and had no problems. For a hotel in the center of the city and considering the price that we paid for our room, I would definately stay here again, as I think it was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent”
Reviews.Author: alkof
Reviews.Content: Clean, tidy with friendly staff. Convenient, contemporary design rooms with a lot of natural light. Metro nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good, especially for business travels”
Reviews.Author: grickavjestica
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, rooms spacious enough, bathroom very clean. What I do not like is open wardrobe but that is a standard in these hotels. Great view to the whole city from the terrace on the 19th floor. Breakfast OK, but not more than that. Free internet access in the rooms, which was important to me. Location fine, just 15-20 min walk to Sagrada Familia. And other parts of the city easily accessible by metro or tram. Staff very nice and helpful. Good service at check-in and -out. The conference area well organized. I would definitely recommend this hotel for conferences and seminars.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Joanna O
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Barcelona and I loved it:) The hotel is excellent, not located in the centre, however everything is easy to access by metro, trams or hop off hop on bus. Very close to local shopping centre. The rooms are the usual Novotel layout, very clean (I am bit obsessed when it comes to cleaniness of bathrooms) and spacious. Loved the music being played in the corridors (you don't get that in UK and it's just such a nice touch). The staff in the hotel was excellent, it was our first visit to Barcelona and we had probably millions of questions and they were always very kind, professional and patient. The gave us very good advices about getting around, finding places to eat and what's the best to see. They just couldn't be more helpful, and they made our stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere between poor and average”
Reviews.Author: Marcotripo
Reviews.Content: Actually stayed here in 2010, but TripAdvisor doesn't let me enter a date further back so I'm just click the oldest date available in the pull down menu (March 2011). So, please understand this review may be dated. This is a Novotel Hotel which means the pictures always look better than the actual hotel. The actual hotel has plenty of street parking, but it's tough finding a spot during the day. But, if you arrive late afternoon and plan to use public transportation, you're in luck. Okay the rooms--which is always most important for me since that's really what I'm paying for--they are adequate. But, there are lots of smokers at Novotel and their HVAC system pumps the air from smokers rooms into non-smoker rooms. Yuk. (My wife just looked over my shoulder and said, "I remember that place, it has the smoke room," so beware). The bathroom is clean and the room, while dated, was okay (aside from the smoke). The service at the front desk was absolutely terrible. Novotel isn't always good (Madrid Novotel is great), but this one was exceptionally bad. I really would not recommend this place to anyone except a smoker who wants a cheap room and uses a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. In the @22 business district. Not centric, but very close.”
Reviews.Author: mdacal
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, in the @22 business district. Not centric, but very close to it. This is a new bisiness district in Barcelona, so dont expect classic european buildings and typical bars. Its all about modernity. Big modern hotels, malls, cloth stores, etc. Although is very close to the center. Next to "La Barceloneta" beach district. Great pool in the last floor. Great views.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, friendly staff. A little way out of town but easy access to metro, etc. A good 25 minute walk to Catalunya Square and Las Ramblas but a nice walk. Sightseeing bus stops outside hotel. Price really good as I got a deal. As a parent, even though we weren't with our kids, it was great as they had interconnecting rooms and a kids area with X-box's, etc. Our son would've loved it. Only downside was cost of breakfast - 18 EUROS is extortionate for a buffet breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable standard of quality with good city access”
Reviews.Author: Somewhere_Special
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Barcelona for over 6 years it was strange that we were staying in a hotel in Barcelona... that said we knew the location well, and it's ideal to get into the city centre (metro, bus and Tramvia stops within minutes), or a 25 minute walk. Equally both shopping centres in Avenida Diagonal can be reached by walking or a few stops byTramvia. The upper floor room (where we stayed) had good city and sea views. The room itself was standard Novotel design (which is modern clean and tasteful furnishing) so we were more than satisfied. Equally the bathroom was modern and had everything we needed. Staff were very helpful and speak both Spanish and English. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, close to the metro”
Reviews.Author: KTA2207
Reviews.Content: We were 3 young couples, spending our New Year in Barcelona and we decided to stay at Novotel. Very nice stay, the personnel was friendly, although not very well informed- we asked what time was the Magic Fountain in Placa Espanya "performing" and we were told 9pm. we asked again, at a souvenir shop in the city center and it was actually from 7.00-8.30pm.. At arrival, the check-in was done very fast and we were given 3 rooms at the 16th floor, with wonderful view of the Agbar tower and La Sagrada Familia, and even Montjuic and the port in the distance. the room was very clean, great big comfy bed. Breakfast- the food was excellent, a large variety of everything, but they had, in my opinion, a very bad system- an employee would check you on the list, and then would walk you to your table!it took a few minutes to every person, and so..every morning we had to stay in a queue for about 10 minutes before entering the breakfast room. Not nice at all! Also, during our stay, they had a problem with the running water- we didn't have any! this happened 3 times, even on the 31st of December, at 9pm- when everybody was getting ready to party. but they eventually fixed it. The metro station-Glories was about 5 minutes walk, direct line to Catalunya, the center of Barcelona, and the place from which La Rambla begins. Also, just across from the hotel you can find Glories shopping mall, not so big, quite small actually, but very handy. Overall, a nice experience!

Reviews.Title: “Full mark !”
Reviews.Author: hwakil
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal Accor guest, and this was my second stay at this hotel. the hotel is new (opened 2010), so all facilities are quite modern. The staff are efficient and friendly, one day I forget and put the room cleaning side the other way round so it was showing "do not disturb" in stead of "Please Clean my Room" and when we returned in the evening we discovered that our room was of course not touched, we called the reception asking for help at least to change the towels, and even this was after hours of cleaning service, a smiling lady came to check the status of the room, we told her the we just need the towels change at least, then we went down for dinner, when we came back back we found the room spotlessly cleaned and tidy, that is a customer service. can't explain more than other reviews about the great location of this hotel but now, thsi is our favourite hotel in Barcelona which we visit every year.

Reviews.Title: “My experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: During my stay, the hotel was very full, (maybe because it was between Xrmas and new year) crowded elevators, so I had to go down by stairs several times. especially in the morning. Very few elevators to the number of rooms... The internet signal in the room was very weak that I could not open some sites and as it was full, I had to wait to use the hotel´s computer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to stay in Barcelona!!!”
Reviews.Author: chuiku2
Reviews.Content: Novotel Barcelona City is the perfect place to stay in Barcelona. It is about 200m from the Glories Metro Stop and a few steps from one of the most beautiful buildings ‘Torre Agbar’. The hotel is also walking distance from another of Barcelona’s most famous landmarks ‘La Sagrada Familia’. The rooms in the hotel are excellent. Every requirement is catered to. The views from the rooms in higher floors are excellent. You can see much of the city from the top. There is an outdoor pool on the terrace; but only usable during summer months. There is also a fitness center on the roof. From the hotel you can get about anywhere to the city to see the important landmarks. There is also a direct tram to the beach right in front of the hotel. The area around the hotel is much safer than most of the other parts of the city and it is OK to come back late at night too. The hotel has a nice bar and also a restaurant. The restaurant food is quite tasty and generous in portions. The only thing I did not like was that you had to wait to be seated even though there were hardly a couple of people in the restaurant. Even then, since I was a solo traveler, I was shown to a small two-person table which was relatively small to keep all my stuff and also have the food. I would have preferred sitting at a larger table, given the fact that there were very few people in the restaurant. One other thing was that the waiters at the restaurant were in a constant hurry and as soon I finished one course they were clearing the plates and then bringing the next course. As soon as I finished my food too, they brought me the bill and I guess expected me to clear out. The reception staffs were much more efficient and helped in choosing the best places to visit via convenient means of transport. There is free wifi at the hotel but it is not very good. It breaks every time you move from a spot and is not even consistent throughout your room. You have to choose a place to sit and use it and can’t use it in motion. Although there is excellent coverage throughout the lobby. It even breaks inside the restaurant. And you need to reenter your username and password again each time which is a pain. One advice also mentioned in your room is Barcelona is not a very safe city. It is prudent to use the safe in the room or at the front desk to store your important documents like Passport and also money, etc while out sightseeing. People try to rob you by distracting you by staining your jacket or shirt and while you are cleaning it off, your valuables vanish. It was tried on me, luckily I escaped.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Good Facilities”
Reviews.Author: canadawolfinottawa
Reviews.Content: I stay at a number of Accor Branded Hotels when I travel so I generally know what to expect before I get there ...yes, they can be expensive but you get what you pay for in the larger European cities .Breakfast is very expensive here but go across the street to the Mall and use the outside down stairs to the outside courtyard as there are lots of places to eat at here.The Mall also has a HUGE grocery store/Carrefour so you can buy ready to eat meals or make your own meals if you are on a budget . There are lots of Fast Food places in and outside the Mall . The Hop On Hop Off bus stop is on the same side of the street as the Mall . It is an excellent way to see the whole city,,buy the 2 day ticket as you will want to get off at a number of Gaudi places and explore them especially the Park . You could walk to Sagrada Familia from the hotel if you really wanted exercise . I did it twice and I am a senior . Agbar, the cone shaped corporate tower is right beside the hotel so you cannot get lost day or night . The staff at the desk are OK.. some are totally excellent some but some are lazy and you really have to butt into their private phone conversations to get their attention . As it is a popular hotel you will have to be patient when checking in or out at prime times even though they have 3 or 4 on staff .The security guard is ALWAYS standing guard over the desk ..why, I have no idea ?? It makes you feel like a criminal ! Lets make him less obvious ! There are 3? free MAC computers to use in the lobby towards the left of the bar .The bar lady is totally excellent as she will give you all kinds of Barcelona travel tips .She is always smiling ..she should be at the front desk .The guard gets bored guarding the desk and he will come over and check to see what everyone is using the computers for ...nosey begger !! I found this annoying ! The room is excellent ..no complaints .Great shower !! Ask for a higher up floor for the views facing Sagrada . A good quiet hotel away from the city center . a little .expensive but it is well worth it. Tip ...if you use the metro be very ,very aware of the Barcelona pickpocketers .Watch out for the "drop your guard scam" involving a local couple asking for directions or spilling something on you , etc . .NEVER have anything in your back pockets even if they are velcroed or even zippered ..they are professionals ! Barcelona is a wonderful city ..just be on your guard !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights with my family (spouse and 2 teenagers). The hotel has an excellent - close to subway, shopping mall (with Carrefour and many restaurants) and tram station. Clean and new furniture. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “not cost effective”
Reviews.Author: yosi55
Reviews.Content: We book this hotel very late. Prices were almost duble the othe hotels same level and dectance from city center. Hotel itself is O.K. but price does not refelct it's worth. Room was stink from smooking,so at late night I cahanged the room. Recomandation: go to other place

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zaganov
Reviews.Content: Good location, warm and helpful staff, wonderfull view from the 18th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: alXpucu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in March 2011 and for sightseeing - the nearest metro station is just a few minutes' walk away and the main palza is probably a 30-min walk from the hotel. The location of a shopping centre literally across from the hotel was also a plus. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel and preferred the cafes at the shopping centre instead. The hotel itself was a very good value for money - we managed to book a 2 for 3 nights deal that they offer on weekdays. General cleanliness was excellent, and so were the rooms - exactly as in the pictures on the website. The nice view from the rooftop pool is also and added benefit - even though it's only open for use in the summer. Staff were really helpful and friendly and we really had no issues with the hotel so would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent haven in busy Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: pmd76
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights in November whilst on a city break in Barcelona. The hotel is in a commercial district, only 3 mins walk from the metro (Glories) and there is a tram stop outside the hotel. The hotel is very modern and clean. The room was large with a minibar, safe, kettle and free Wi-Fi. The rooms have views across the city. There is a large bar area as well as downstairs seating where guests can enjoy comfy chairs and a drink. Breakfast was served in the restaurant and has a wealth of different foods on offer. Cereals, breads, cheeses, meats, cakes etc.. There is also hot food which is freshly cooked by chefs behind the serving counter. I also ate in the restaurant and the food was of a very high standard. The menu is limited but there is something for everyone. There is a modern shopping centre across the road that has a number of reasonably priced restaurants as well as a large supermarket. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a quieter stay in Barcelona without wanting to be too far out of town.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel away from centre”
Reviews.Author: HHHYYY
Reviews.Content: Room is clean and has basic amenity. Mini bar, safe, hairdryer shampoo and so on. No bathtub. Althought the shower room is large enough, it only has a shower booth. 5-7min walk from metro station, Glorias. Bus stop is only a min away from the hotel so it is easier to get to central area. Staff are friendly and helpful. Speaks various languages fluently. Bed is ok but sofa bed is not that comfortable as we expected. This hotel is good value if you don't care for much about sightseeing of old central of Barcelona. Or it is good if you have long stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: FdV62
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights to attend a conference at the CIBB which is about 3 kilometers from the hotel. The Novotel is located on the 'Diagonal', a broad road with good running / walking / cycling area in the middle of the road. Bicycles can be rented for a deposit from various stations close to the hotel. The rooms are simple but well appointed. It was very clean and the service was as expected. The hotel provides good value for money as a business hotel. The minibar drinks and the restaurant / bar are very reasonably priced. Simple breakfast starts from Euro 3.50. Overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Rmlondontx
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - about 7/8 mins from metro. Easy access to the tram to the beach. Staff was very friendly especially the person who worked with kids at breakfast. Rooms were clean and modern. Pool was nice just cold while we were there

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel, but uninspiring location”
Reviews.Author: freiburg13
Reviews.Content: This Novotel provided much more enjoyable experience than the one I stayed in London. This is primarily business hotel surrounded by other business hotels, shopping mall and infamous (but interesting) Torres Akbar. It is convenient to CCIB where I attended conference. Metro station is nearby, but the only interesting place you can walk to is Poblenou district. Rather than location, it was excellent: tasteful rooms, nice modern design, no problems with the service. Excellent value for the room. Didn't eat overpriced breakfast, cannot comment on the food. Hotel has nice facilities, even hammam, but off-season their bar and pool on the 19th floor are closed. All in all, good hotel for business.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night with my family (2 teenagers) and I chose family room. The room is spacious, clean and very quiet, so we could sleep well. The receptionists were friendly and they could give me suggestion about the suitable ticket of public transport for us. The breakfast menu is various and the taste was very nice, unfortunately there was no available menu for vegan, except fruits and potatoes.

Reviews.Title: “What can I say, it's a Novotel!”
Reviews.Author: RPMol
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are cheaply decorated, poor quality towels and amnities. Remote for the TV wasn't working but no replacement or repair possible in the evening because the maintenance department wasn't working! Please come back tomorrow morning! Location from CCIB is not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, any which way you look at it!”
Reviews.Author: AirBizTraveller
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at this hotel I must say its about as good as it can get in Barcelona. Besides being new and all it is also not much of a walk to the Glories metro and just across the road from the mall. I did not discover the mall as I thought it was only a small Carrefour. But I was surprised to find that it was actually quite a huge shopping centre. The hotel offers a good rate for parking (18€ per day) and saves you the trouble of leaving your vehicle outside as it is rather unsafe. From the hotel you can move around conveniently by metro and tram lines. There is a jolly good pizza restaurant across the road that gets you a pizza and a beer for under €8!

Reviews.Title: “It s amazing. Absolutely amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: distance10
Reviews.Content: Maybe one of the best Novotels around Europe. The room, the bathroom and their equipment is the typical for the Novotels, but the difference here is the Staff. They are all extremely friendly, very professional, and most important the hotel is very clean. Ask for rooms on higher floors for a panoramic view of Barcelona, and don t forget to visit the pool on the terrace. The hotel is good situated next to the Glorias metro station, but if you are a little bit fit, I would recommend you to walk to the La Sagrada Familia( it gets only 10 min. walk). Near to the hotel, you will find a lovely shopping center, with plenty of Cafes, restaurants, a supermarket and many many shopping possibilities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Overall”
Reviews.Author: WillieC
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here pre-cruise late October 2011. The hotel is a typical Novotel - contemporary design and furnishings, decent sized rooms and nice Euro-style baths. It is not in the city center but is just a short metro ride away. The metro station is just down the street a very short walk. Our room was on the sixth floor with a view of the Tower Agbar (just down the street) and the Sagrada Familia (which we were able to walk to about 3/4 mile). The room was clean but the carpet had been burned in one spot (probably an iron) and needed to be replaced. It did not impact the room but it was unsightly. The room had a sofa, queen sized bed, work desk, digital safe, minibar with items for purchase (it had enough room to hold our wine as well). There is also a water kettle and instant coffee and tea in the room. Housekeeping was excellent and kept the room clean. Note there is no ice machine (typical for Europe but the bar will provide ice if you want to traipse down to the lobby). The hotel will store bags for those like us that arrive early. There is no charge for this service. The lobby was very attractive and quite busy at most times. Lots of airline crews stay here even though it is about a 30-35 minute ride at least to the airport. Our taxi from airport to hotel cost around E35 as I recall. We did not use the hotel dining room but it looked quite nice. The rooftop terrace offers great views and has a pool which we did not use as it was too cool for swimming. There are several places to sit here as well. The exercise center is also on this level and had a nice selection of equipment. Right across the street is a large shopping center that has a Starbucks and several places to eat. The restaurant right on the entrance to the center is quite good and reasonably priced. It is called Canas y Tapas. There are also several places to get pastries in the mornings to take back to the hotel. Do not expect to walk over to Starbucks for a latte early in the morning - they do not open until 10am! Have a coffee con leche instead at one of the little cafes. Overall we were happy with the Novotel. It is just a bit removed from the old part of Barcelona but the metro makes it convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KandAC Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel and its location: just across from a shopping mall with loads of restaurants to choose from. The no. 7 bus stops in front of the hotel and takes you almost to the gates of the Barcelona stadium. The Barcelona Bus Turistic hop-on/hop-off bus also stops in front of the hotel, and the Glories metro station is just around the corner. I have only three complaints: 1) air-conditioning seemed to be lowered at night so the room got quite warm; 2) the three lifts sometimes had difficulties in handling all the traffic at peak times and 3) wi-fi in our room on the 18th floor was a bit hit and miss.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but shouldn't be called a City hotel”
Reviews.Author: AFrequentTraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the technology area of Barcelona not in the area where most tourist attractions are so you will need to use bus, tram or metro to get into the city. The hotel itself is very modern and its newness is evident by the lack of experience of some of the front desk staff. Rooms are on the small side but very comfortable and also quiet. As has been described before the hotel struggles when it is full to deliver an acceptable level of service. The pool on the roof is good and there are great views across the surrounding area and the nearby Torre Agbar certainly looks spectacular at night. We only ate breakfast in the hotel, which was pretty good although long waits for a table on occassion. We found a nearby street which had lots of reasonably priced restaurants frequented by locals where the food was excellent and prices very reasonable. If you exit the hotel and turn right and right again onto the main road, walk three blocks and turn right - in a couple of hundre yards you will enter the restaurant area. A great day trip is to take the train to Monserrat which is very impressive - takes about one and a half hours from the hotel via metro, train and furnicular. Avoid the weekends if possible, especially Sunday, as it is very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 555Carol Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there 3 nights prior to our cruise. We found it to be a wonderful hotel with great staff. We would definitely stay there again. Location is great if you don't mind walking a bit. Lots of restaurants close by and having the mall across the street was great. After visiting La Ramblas, we were quite content to get back to our hotel in a quieter district.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great staff - WIFI needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: momap
Reviews.Content: Relaxing and quiet place, nice view from the roof top. Great value hotel, location is close to shopping and public transportation. One inconvenience was the WIFI, very weak, inside the room no signal, we had to stay in front of the elevator to connect to internet. Desk staff very helpful - we forgot couple paintings in our room, called hotel from the airport and they managed to get them in the airplane, just before closing airplane doors !

Reviews.Title: “An afternoon in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, clean , good sized room. A little bit out of town. about half an hours walk from town centre but 5 minutes on the Metro which was 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Friendly staff. We had dinner the hotel restaurant which was also good

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Jeedr66
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new hotel in a very modern part of Barcelona within the City center. It's located next to the controversial but very noticeable "Torre Agbar" (Agbar Tower) and very close to the "Sagrada Familia" (one of Barcelona's main tourism attractions). The Barcelona Metro station ("Glories") is one block from the hotel and the Tram stops literally in front of the hotel. Across the hotel is the "Les Glories" shopping center and a few blocks (a couple of Tram stops away) is the "Diagonal Mar" mall. Tipical cab fares to the "Paseo de Gracia" ("Passeig de Gracia") or the "Gran Vía" areas, run between 8 to 12 EUR. Like I said, the hotel is very new and modern. The rooms are very confortable and make a very efficient use of the space (tipical of the Novotel hotels). It has an underground parking garage if you need to park your car while in Barcelona (there is a fee of about 18 EUR per day). The staff was always very friendly at all times. In general we had a very nice stay at this hotel. Certainly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: imouzakis
Reviews.Content: An exellent city hotel. Relatively bear the center. Very quite. Transportaion availabilities very close. The rooms have an "IKEA like" atmosphere but in general very cosy and very clean. An very nice resturant wth relatively good prices. Breakfast is also very "rich". Free Wifi with good signal. Overall a very good choice for traveling in magnificent Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to the metro”
Reviews.Author: jaymakins
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The breakfast buffet is good, and the computers are free. But no free wifi. If you need an outlet converter or iron you have to put a deposit down at the front desk. The room as very nice and comfortable, but there was a slight odor in the room. It may have been from the water, I'm not sure, but there was an odor. The location of the hotel was very good because it was close to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: JMI75
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new property, rooms are very nice, although a bit cramped. We stayed with 2 children and we were at the limit. The staff is very helpful and knowledgeable, they provide excellent service. Although there is a metro station 2 blocks from the hotel, location is not a strong point if you are touring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Newton1976
Reviews.Content: Nice place, excellent the smimmingpool at the 19th floor with a nice view all over the city

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously overpriced for what is offered”
Reviews.Author: FloridaJudge
Reviews.Content: Basic, adequate hotel that is nevertheless very overpriced for location and facilities. Nice views of the city and Sagrada Familia from upper floors. Sagrada Familia is a comfortable walk away, but everything else quite a distance.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly very good”
Reviews.Author: ohmiso
Reviews.Content: As the hotel is pretty new the room was fine and it was very clean. The breakfast was good. The hotel was reasonably priced for the standard, especially given it was F1 weekend which has proven expensive in other cities. We stayed on a very warm weekend in May and were disappointed to find we couldn't use the pool. Service was OK. We arrived at 10am after 30 hours of travel and despite asking were told they wouldn't be able to get us in before 2pm. We went over to the Glories shopping centre and went back at 1.30pm when, fortunately, we were checked in.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay for a family”
Reviews.Author: Pascal T
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 days in Barcellona and the novotel was just great for us. it is near the center our rooms were on the top of the building. Service and breakfast very good. we reccommend it very much.

Reviews.Title: “needs better wi fi”
Reviews.Author: rayfish999
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 days in September 2011 , its very definetly a business hotel, a bit formal and not really suitablle for a relaxed vacation stay,its got a stylish business class interior and the room was comfortable with modern designer fittings as you would expect in a stylish city such as Barcelona. The rooms where at a good price when compared to central Barcelona hotels but the meals where expensive especially as you can walk across the road to the Glories shopping centre where there are a multitude of restruants open from 8 am to 10 pm ( except sunday when just a few are open)and eat for a fraction of the cost of a meal in the hotel restruant Although its righ on a main artery, Its not really central so taxies are required to get to and from central Barcelona or, if you can master the transit system, there is a very efficient service into the centre by tram , bus or metro at low cost, also the open top tourist bus has a stop just across the road. The main problem for me was the wifi internet connection was very poor. the only way to get on line was to stand just behind the door of the room where the computer rated the signal as low, otherwise the signal within the room as very low and impossible to get on line. I find it incredible that a business hotel had such a poor connection with no LAN port available. To sum up, a good value business hotel with poor WIFI, modern clean and comfortable,

Reviews.Title: “'jazzy'”
Reviews.Author: Jacobwilliam
Reviews.Content: Fantastic value for money, perfect location, and what a view. In my 13 year old daughter Cerys' words "amazing, pretty jazzy"

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: PaulandJulie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for 3 nights and it was fantastic! We had a room on the 16th floor with amazing views. The room was clean and spacious (normal Novotel standard). We had breakfast inc in our deal and there was plenty to choose from along with chef cooking omelettes to order. The pool/bar area (on 19th floor) is especially welcome after a hot days sightseeing again with excellent views over beach/city. There is a shopping centre opposite the hotel which was ideal for evening meals and again we recommend this. The metro is a five min walk from hotel and very easy to use. We cannot fault this hotel and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Branko55
Reviews.Content: Had to book at very short notice so we opted for the Novotel as we couldn't afford to risk the the five days we were spending in Barcelona by staying in a dodgey hotel. Great location, helpful and attentive staff. After a hectic day enjoying all of what Bercelona has to offer it was great to come back to the Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but......”
Reviews.Author: Babyface777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on great location, shopping mall nearby, 5 min walk literally. It is near Sagrada Familia attraction too. Hotel is clean, usual art deco Novotel. Unfortunately, staff is slow and not so attentive. I requested for iron/board late night, after calling several times they said it is coming however it never came. No one called back and I do not know what happened. Elevator takes forever especially during the morning rush of check out's and people going out. I wish they will improved this situation.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: NordicSun
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal with free nights in this hotel. Very satisfied with the room. Breakfast was something to be waiting for each morning. Great selection, beautiful premises. The location was fine, good connections by bus or tram. On the opposite street, there was a nice shopping mall. Roof top gym and pool were great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice view, well located”
Reviews.Author: nicomedbxl Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel. Rooms are nice, well furnished and soundproofed. Cable TV with lots of foreign channels. We had a room at the 17h floor with a nice view on the Torre Agbar, Sagrada Familia, the sea, Tibidabo, etc. Small swimming pool on the roof with Hammam. We did not have breakfast because of the price and the facilities available just at the corner...Also, the Glories Shopping Mall is just in front and so is the metro station which is very practical. Only 4 stops to Plaza Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and affordable”
Reviews.Content: We chose the Novotel Barcelona City for a nights stay pre-cruise and found it to be a great choice for the night. There is a shopping center across the street with a grocery store which was great to pick up a few things to bring with us on the cruise. It was challenging to find a "family room" in Europe so we were pleased to find they had rooms to sleep more than 2. This way we didn't have to get a separate room for our teenage son. We went up to the rooftop pool for awhile but it was kind of windy and most of the loungers were taken already plus the water in the pool was cold so we didn't stay too long. But it's a nice ammenity, especially if you have younger kids. They didn't seem to mind the cold water. We asked for suggestions on places to eat dinner and were directed to a great pedestrian area a few blocks away with lots of little restaurants & cafes to choose from. We purchased the breakfast with our room and were pleased to find it to actually be a nice buffet with a lot of options (hot and cold). Everything from eggs & various meats to pastries, cereals & fruit. And a pot of "American" coffee for the table!! Definitely worth including the breakfast. I would include pictures but really the ones already posted here are accurate and I would just be duplicating some of the same shots. It was no frills but clean and convenient. Can't go wrong for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for one night stopover in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: hilarytravel
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly. They dealt efficiently and professionally with a problem with the internet booking. The room was adequate but small. The on roof pool was delightful but was small. The views of Barcelona from the pool and adjoining cafe amazing. The picture of what looks like a jacuzzi isn't - it is a babies pool - very disappointing. The location is good, next to a shopping centre, tram stop and taxi's right outside. Easy access to central Barcelona. There are not enough lifts for the number of people using them. There is safe underground parking which is available after checkout time.

Reviews.Title: “Just a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carla D
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 nights at Novotel City and it was pretty average. view was lovely, service shoddy. we were not assisted with our luggage or shown to our rooms. when I requested an extra pillow I was advised that there were none available. pool only open from 11am to 7pm, so no early swims. Will spend my time and money elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to usual standard”
Reviews.Author: joe7544
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a number of Novotels across Europe they all deliver a pretty standard product which allows you to book the chain knowing what you are getting . However my experience of the chaos that greeted my arrival at this hotel was not quite what I was expecting . The reception was littered with families ,air crews and irate business men all waiting for rooms. I waited three hours for a room to be allocated without eeven an explanation or reason from the receptionists.. The rooms were clean if a little worn and shabby . The roof pool and spa was a bit cramped. The real entertainment comes in the shape of the tthree lifts that service 19 floors of rooms . Some people waited up to 30 minutes during the morning to access a lift through the sheer number of people using them . I Will certainly be seeking alternate accomodation nexo time in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: DublinFionaC
Reviews.Content: Just returned from family trip to Barca. Having stayed in different Novotels and always had good experience this one was no exception. Hotel was excellent. We had a family room with queensize bed and double sofa bed for the four of us (2 ad and 2 children), it was clean, bed comfortable and bathroom was lovely. Air con very effective too. We had a buffet breakfast included in our rate which was great - they had plenty of lovely food - something for everyone's taste all served in a large area so no queues each morning. They even had nespresso coffee machines which really impressed me. The terrace on the 19th floor had amazing views along with pool and lovely comfortable loungers - although quite small it was great for an hour or two away from sightseeing. They also have a gym and sauna. This hotel is in a great location as we didnt want to stay right in the centre. Hotel was easily accessible to Las Rambas by metro only 4 stops to Catalunya and we walked it in about 20-25 mins. The open top bus (recommended) stopped just across the road. The tram also stopped at top of the street. Hotel is right beside the Torre Agbar tower which is a great landmark for finding your way home. We really loved this hotel and would definitely stay again next time we visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location but poor room service”
Reviews.Author: Andrew H
Reviews.Content: First impressions of this hotel were good, slick check in and upgraded to a suite, nice! We visited the outdoor area on floor 19 which is lovely and the views from the room were good, generally we were very happy with the hotel. However unfortunately there were a couple of issues. We ordered room service at 10pm and it failed to arrive within an hour, and room service closed at 11. I called room service, no reply, so I called the front desk who were quite curt and tried to put me through to room service, but surprise, surprise, no answer, so the lady on the front desk said she would call me back. 15 minutes later and she called back to say the meals were 'in the lift' right now. 20 minutes later they arrived and looked like they had been under a food heater for some time. Not ideal, but as it was not late and the choice to food to eat quite limited we accepted the meals. The other issue is maybe just personal, but what they call atmospheric lighting in the rooms I would class as just plain dark! A few extra lamps would be more than welcome. We also had breakfast which I found perfectly acceptable and would book again. I would stay at this hotel again, but I would not order room service!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Barca!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Such a lovely hotel with brilliant views and great service. We were upgraded to a suite upon our arrival. The terrace view was amazing and it was such a treat sitting up there on a bright summers day. The location was good too. Just round the corner from a metro station which will take you everywhere in the city. Out son in only 4 and he also loved the hotel. Slight downside was that the English Satalite channels did not work apart from the news and the bed wasnt the comfiest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Richard N
Reviews.Content: Good quality hotel, in great location on Avenida Diagonal near Torre Agbar (a building similar to London Gherkin) and the Glories Shopping Centre. Tourist hop on / hop off bus stop right outside with a readily availble supply of licenced cabs in rank right outside. We had been told the Ave Diag was not the best place to stay but it felt very safe (with two young boys aged 5 &8) and room had a safe and secure parking (we are told this is a must for a car with non Spanish number plates). It was all reassuring. Room was very clean and the air conditioning was effective. Staff very helpful - although took a little coaxing to get the help initially. Expensive, but we thought it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely new rooms and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Irene B
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing experience. The hotel is well connected to the historic centre, clean and new and quiet. The staff is incredibly friendly and the breakfast is amazing! The hotel has a roof terrace from which there is an amazing view. Would definately reccomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: ma65
Reviews.Content: Location is fine. Although not walking distance to the Rambla or Passeig de Gracia, it is a very short walk (one minute or two) to the underground where the red line takes you to Plaça de Catalunya in about 5 minutes. As we arrived by car, the Novotel presents the considerable advantage of a large and safe underground parking (paid, about 19 euros per day). Although Novotel advertises itself as a family friendly hotel (“kids stay free”), it should be noted that kids under 16 do indeed stay free, but in the existing bedding, which is (apart form the parents’ bed) a rather narrow sofa bed (120 cm broad). This may be fine if you are travelling with toddlers, but it hardly works with two teenagers… What's more, the rooms are quite small and once the sofa bed is unfolded, there is very little space left and certainly no room for an extra bed (even if they would offer you one). The bathroom door is of glass, so if someone puts on the light in the bathroom in the middle of the night, it wakes up the other ones in the room. Not a very good idea, really… Breakfast is fine, but nothing exceptional, and hardly worth the 17 euros charged (per adult, kids get a free breakfast). And yes, there is a rooftop pool, but it is quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for European hotels”
Reviews.Author: elmoro
Reviews.Content: Had a hard time finding a hotel with 2 double beds and a reasonable rate. This hotel did it for us. Stayed 1 night before our NCL cruise out of BCN with family (kids 10 and 7). Modern, clean, helpful and nice reception staff. They also stored the luggage for us (for free) during the morning prior to the cruise. The room has huge. I think we got upgraded to a suite but not sure as I was too tired to ask upon arrival. Great value, great location with a shopping mall a block or two away to get emergency clothes or a bite to eat. Also close to a metro station. Taxis ready to take you anywhere. Fare to the port was about 10 euros if I remember correctly and took about 20 minutes on a weekend (city had no traffic!). One note/caveat: my wife forgot a jacket inside one of the closets. The next Sunday, after returning from our cruise, we went to the hotel and inquired to see if it had been found. Unfortunately, it was not found according to the reception and housekeeping staff. I find this a little strange but not much i can do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location. Above Novotel's standard.”
Reviews.Author: ash729
Reviews.Content: I've slept in many Novotels. And this one is much different. Above of all Novotel standards you will get fantastic view of the sea plus amenities like pool on the highest floor. Someone can complain about construction works nearby. But if you have the room on the right side and floor, this is just negligible. We were upgraded to family room in which we found 2 TVs, nice but cool glass desk and modern finishing of rooms. Location of this hotel maybe is not central, but near is commercial area, metro and tram lines. Also have easy access from bus station, even on foot. You can also catch the local market just on the other side of the Glories roundabout.

Reviews.Title: “Great roof terrace and convenient for metro and tram !”
Reviews.Author: Mrspricklepants
Reviews.Content: Great size interlocking rooms, the pool and roof terrace area is amazing with great views over the city and the cucumber (torre agber). Great value for families.

Reviews.Title: “Will consider staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location! Staff are excellent and always willing to help... time to time.. there's a language barrier kicking in.. but it's understandable... be patient and ask the question again in adifferent way...

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Stayed in a very clean family room with a 13 and 9 year old. The only downside was the room size. It could have been somewhat larger and the room overlooked a building site. Lovely terrace and pool with fabulous views across Barcelona. Excellent location and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in an overpriced city! Recommended for sure!”
Reviews.Author: rabfel
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel very much. The staff was amazing, they were friendly, knowledgable and always willing to go the extra mile to help. We took advantage of a special rate accor hotels has for families where you get a second room for 50% off if traveling with children. The rooms were nice, clean and very modern. TV slightly small but flat screen. Beds were comfortable and rooms have a pull out sofa bed that according to m kids was not at all bad. The restrooms are nice and spacious, very modern though so the shower is see through... Yo are within 10 min walk of La Sagrada Familia, there is a rather ig mall accross the street with many restaurants and shops. We found the food in the hotel to be good, breakfast was a bargain and so was dinner compared to the prices outside. We didn't like the breakfast room because it stunk of bacon tremendously buhe dinner buffett is served in the restauran which is very nice and very good! Excellent food for the dinner buffet, a fraction of the cost for the same food that yiu pay through the roof outside including Paella. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to fzmilies wih children. BTW it is a 25 to 35 euro ride from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great end to a fabulous holiday”
Reviews.Author: LHC20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Barcelona at the end of a 12 day cruise (another review) for 3 nights. We found the hotel to be modern and room was very comfortable. Service at the font desk was friendly and efficient. The hotel is situated right next door to the Torre Agbar, an unusual bullet shaped building. Although not close to Las Ramblas, a $6 euro cab ride will get you to the city centre and all cab drivers know where the "Torre Agbar" is on your return. They served an express breakfast in the lobby, a danish or sandwich + coffee for $4.50 euro. Although on the last day we found a bakery just down the road that made the best pizzas and croissants. There is a large shopping centre across the road Les Glories which had a Zara store. The only disappointment was that the PC in the lobby for guest use was "out of service" on the 2nd day and still not repaired by the end of our stay. However, front desk was accommodating and printed out our boarding passes for us. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We spent 12 days in Novotel Barcelona City and everything was great. The room in 17 th floor was amazing and the view was wonderful. Room was very silent and we also liked the pool area in 19 th floor. Breakfast was very good and possibility to use internet was also very good. There was metro and tram very near so it was very easy to move everywhere. We liked very much and maybe we will come back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay to see city.”
Reviews.Author: AJMTrips
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before and after a cruise. Location is not very central, but close to metro and tourist bus, so it is easy to get to all the attractions in the city. Rooms clean and bright, rooftop pool looks nice, although we didn't try it as we were busy most days in the city. Buffet breakfast on the Saturday was held in the function room rather than the restaurant. This was a little crowded, and some of the food was not very hot. On normal week days, it was in the restaurant, which was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: blackspaniel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 26 to 30 June 2011. This is a great hotel and very good value for money. We stayed in a double room with sofa bed for our two teenagers, and the room was very comfortable, modern and clean. Bathroom of good size with big shower. Check in went quick, and there was no problem for us to check in at 23h00. Staff was friendly and very helpful. The hotel is modern, clean, and breakfast was available for us at an extra cost. Only the two adults pay for breakfast and the children are free. The breakfast was good, consisted of jogurt, fruit, breads, pastries, egg ,bacon etc. The hotel is very well located, nearest metro station is about 3 min walk from hotel, from this metro you can reach La Ramblas in two stops, easy to get to Camp Nou, Familia Sagrada, Port etc. Will definitely stay in this hotel again, and will recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “average hotel. not bad but not too good either.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 1) the shower door does not work. this make us taking shower on the bath tub instead of in the shower to avoid water flooding the floor. 2) the sink water stopper dont work for both sink, until got fixed the next day. 3) the food in the hotel is terrible and extremely expensive. no wonder we did not see more than a few people even on Saturday night. 4) the service is on the low side. I got trouble calling to the airport from using the public phone and none of the staff were willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have been in Europe in my life”
Reviews.Author: Montreal35457382
Reviews.Content: My company as a contract with Barcelona Novotel 20 rooms a night for the whole summer, we waited 2 1/2 hours for our room, and there was a whole lot of other customers who waited as long! The lobby was like a war zone with people sleepin everywhere on there sofas! There was not enough staff at the front desk 3 persons at check in? When I finally got my room, I notice the bed had no bed sheets? only a duvet cover, I was wondering if the cover was change front previous guess? Kind of weard! Half of hotel room have no view over looking an office building accross which is less then 100 feets...hotel is far located middle of no where...in a residencial area...no where to eat close by...a good 40 minutes walk from the beach. They advertise free internet? Maybe they should charge and have I speed...it take about 2-3 minutes to get any pages open on your browser.... When I came back at 22:00 at night to my hotel, I needed a new password for the internet, there was still a line up at front desk and only one clerk, I gave up and left. Absolutely no service in this hotel....they need more staff.... They I thought maybe I can enjoy the pool on the roof...well it is close...and the lounge adjacent was quite dirty...not really the kind of site you want to see when you pay that kind of money for an hotel. I would not recomand this Hotel unless you are on a budget and get a crazy deal for it, because its not worth more then 75 euro a night...and what you might save you will pat the difference in taxi fare.... cheers

Reviews.Title: “AClub”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On Cecking into hotel showed my gold A Club card time around 300pm was given a room overlooking a work site,on a lower floor no view.The lifts were inadequate for the amount of rooms long waits . Would not stay or recomend this hotel for any one .

Reviews.Title: “Aircondition switched off”
Reviews.Author: apomaz1
Reviews.Content: Poor service at the reception The employees bored to talk Aircondition was switched off due the economic crisis,we couldn't sleep at night Room was overal as any novotel Very bad smell when you enter the hotel entrance they should do something about it It is not possible to remain at the lobby with that smell

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel for a family on vacation in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: tunafishOslo
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel a lot. The hotel was both close to the beach (25 minutes walk or 10 minutes with a taxi) and close to the city centre (4 stops on the metro). It was a modern and clean hotel with frindly staff. We liked the top terrasse a lot, with a little swimming pool where the childen could swim and play. Children under 16 years had free breakfast. We would recommend this hotel to other families.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good service and offers (swimmingpool etc.) We would like that the restaurant have had at ala carte menu also. Very good rooms, and we will stay there again if we come back. xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good suite. Big bathroom. There is a second restroom. Hotel lacated Near trade center. Good restaraunt, but not liked bufet. Hotel have a sauna, pool and fitnes center and Room for play children.

Reviews.Title: “This was our second stay - we love it!!”
Reviews.Author: john_jane_carver
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little way out of the tourist centre of Barcelona but it is in very easy distance to one of the metro stops and a very quick journey to the centre. It is an excellent hotel and was opened less than 2 years ago. The hotel has 19 floors - on the top is the pool, sunbathing area and pool bar. It is spectacular with wonderful views all over the city. There is a good on site restaurant where we've had good meals. Breakfast is served here too - nice varied choices. The staff are friendly, efficient and helpful. The first time we went we went we stayed in room on the 18th floor and asked for it the second time and got it. It's a wonderful double aspect room with fabulous city views. The hotel is clean and well kept. there is an excellent shopping centre just across the road. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - very helpful staff - every aspect of stay was great. Would recommend to anyone travelling to Barcelona. Transport is easily accessed and there is a great shopping centre within five minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MatherFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for a 50th birthday celebration and were not disappointed. The hotel is in a great location as it is outside of the main city centre but is near to a metro stop which is only 5 minutes to the heart of the city. An added bonus is that one of the open top bus tours stops right outside the hotel with options to do tours on both an eastern and western route around the city which take in all of the main sights / tourist attractions. We found this a great way of seeing everything in the limited time we had and we hopped off the bus at various points around the city. We chose the hotel mainly because of the 19th floor rooftop pool and found this a great way for our children to unwind after a busy day whilst we took in the fantastic views of the city. Breakfast was included in the deal we got and was nice but we didn't consider it to be worth the advertised price. We did eat in the hotel on one evening but found the buffet food to be overpriced and not particulary hot. We had much nicer meals in the restaurants in the shopping centre opposite; Ginos Italian restaurant is particularly recommended. All in all a great birthday in a great hotel in a great city!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel geared both to families and couples”
Reviews.Author: socarras4
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 2 nights before our cruise. The staff was very nice and the rooms were great for a family of 4. central location, walking distance to restaurants and the metro. Also, the rooftop pool and view is amazing. the hotel had a very good restaurant on site. We would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotel Barcelona is a nice hotel situated 10 minutes from the city centre. The staff is friendly and the pool area located on the top of the building is magnificent. The rooms are clean and modern. Children under the age of 16 stays for free in all of Novotels hotels

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value... will be back!”
Reviews.Author: trabeler1
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on good reviews and were not disappointed. Novotel offered a 4 nights for 3 rate and did not charge extra for children. Although located a little outside of the city, the hotel is only a block from the Glories metro station. 3 or 4 stops on the metro and you're at Las Ramblas. The hotel is clean, comfortable, and quiet. The staff seemed a little overstretched at times... for example it took three calls to get an iron brought to the room. We did not use the restaurant at the hotel since there were more options at much cheaper prices at the large mall across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great views over the city, near public transports”
Reviews.Author: JotaPortugal
Reviews.Content: Great views on the 19th floor over the city. Near Tram and Metro lines that easily connect you to the main attractions in the city. Next to Glories shopping center and Carrefour Hypermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth as it should be in Novotel style”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit outside of the CBD and major shooping areas, and almost nera to the consturction sites. The new constrcution is unfinished due to the curreent econnomic bust. The hotel boosts its location and nearestness to La Sagrrada Familia. From the top roogf, we can see it , but we have never tried due to our sightseeing schedule. The hotel is contemporay built to the Novotel standard specifications. The spaciousness is OK, but the toilt is not separted and only ensuite shower faiclity is available. The modernity ensures of the cleanness. The service is a littele bit unattentative to our eyes, while admittedly up to the standards of this class. It can be said that it is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing rooms, a great choice”
Reviews.Author: Ghost71
Reviews.Content: Located very well in the heart of the city. The metro is only 5 minutes walk and Glories Mall right opposite which has very good eating & shopping options. The rooms are excellent and very modern and the buffet breakfast is a must. The terrace pool is fantastic. Would love to go back..

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelfan93312
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The staff was extremely helpful. Susanna Sanchez went out of her way to verify our flight reservations, make dinner reservations, arranged early morning taxis for the family. There is a Hop on - Hop off bus for Barcelona City tours directly across the street. The subway is nearby. The pool is on the top floor with amazing views of the city. Ask for a room that ends in 31; example 1331, 1531, 931.... Great corner rooms with views of the city. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & service at Novotel Barcelona City!!”
Reviews.Author: nazi062011
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on this hotel on the Trip Advisor and I am so happy to have chosen it. The location and service was beyond what I had expected. There is a mall conveniently located across the street from the hotel. Starbucks and a grocery store which we could pick up fruits, water, bread etc. The hotel is a few minutes away from the metro and 4 stops away from the city centre and the Ramblas. This was my third trip to Barcelona and this hotel was definitely the best one in terms of convenient and location. Will definitely go back and recommend to everyone. The restaurant at the hotel has excellent meals as well. A great rooftop pool as well. It is also 15 minutes walk away from the beach. Can not go wrong with this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mid-week stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel was easy to find, having researched its location and the nearest Metro station (Glories) on the L1 (red) line. The reception area is bright, modern and airy, and there are a number of lifts to speed up check-in and room transfer. We were very lucky to have a room on the 18th floor (of 19), so we were afforded great views of the city from above. the bed was extremely comfortable and the shower was great, in a modern and clean bathroom. Our favourite part of the hotel was the rooftop bar and pool area, which was very relaxing after a day's sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience overall”
Reviews.Author: Buckaroo-8th
