Reviews.Content: For a family with elementary school-aged children this hotel is outstanding. They can accommodate the parents and two kids in the same room with the little ones sharing a sleep sofa. Ours were quite happy with this arrangement. You probably can't waltz comfortably in the remaining space but presumably that's not why you're in Barcelona. The rooftop pool (with fabulous views) was a big hit as was the kids' play corner in the lobby. The fitness area was well equipped for a hotel although ventilation could be improved. The hotel is and feels new and all spaces seemed clean and in excellent repair. The breakfast is outstanding if a bit pricey at 20 Euros per adult. The children eat for free, however. The staff was very friendly and helpful throughout. There are only two downsides worth mentioning and neither bothered us very much. First, the hotel is a bit out of the center and the immediate area does not have "obvious" tourist attractions. Having said that, there are ameliorating circumstances: 1) a mall right across the street where you can conveniently get some groceries, snacks, or a piece of clothing you forgot to pack, 2) a metro station two blocks away from which you can get to the heart of Barcelona in about 5 stops, 3) a half dozen new office/university buildings in the immediate vicinity which architecture mavens would definitely find interesting. Second, while we were there a number of larger groups (package tours perhaps) came through, seemingly staying for a single night. Nothing wrong with that, but it did tend to gum up access to the reception and elevators and it seems like something that the hotel management could improve on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in the shadow of the Barcelona landmark Torre Agbar building”
Reviews.Author: Luc Spiessens Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Splendid location of the hotel near teh Torre Agbar landmark building and easily accessable by car. We used the reserved car park on -3 floor and took public transportation (metro - tram) from the hotel to enjoy Barcelona. The car park bill could be settled at the hotel reception desk which is convenient because the pay machine in the car park does not accept credit cards. Check-in at the reception went very smoothly as by chance the friendly staff member was Dutch and addressed us in our native tongue. He was so kind to explain the metro system and handed a map of the underground network. The room on the 8th floor had a wonderfull view on the city, was clean and overall nice to stay. The rain shower in the bath room was a nice new item to our Novotel experiences. Free of charge WIFI in the room and the bar using a 3 day personalised access code for security. Well appreciated - some large hotel chains still charge for internet usage. Breakfast buffet was plentiful and nice but very expensive compared to the many desayunes opportunities there are across the street in the Glories commercial center. (The hotel also offers a less expensive Bar Breakfast). Dinner is served in a modern, stylish, nice setting with open view kitchen. Our dinner tasted very well and was relatively inexpensive. The bar is the highlight area of the hotel: colourfull and spacious seats that really suit young people best. The lady in the bar that worked the evening shift during our stay, should be commended as "employee of the month". She worked very hard and quickly, always kept a nice smile on her face even when the bar was swamped by returning guests from an evening out and all of them wanted a last drink at the same time. It was a joy to see her remain calm and well organized. Things like this make a stay at Novotel Barcelona City a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “The best experience in Barca”
Reviews.Author: marice81
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel with the best food and the best breakfast ever! It is very close to the city center, very nearby the hop-on hop-off stops of buses. It is very peaceful hotel. The overall service is excellent. The minor problem is that some of the personnel speaks English badly but you can always find somebody that will help you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay before and after a cruise from Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: kimhhuang
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a cruise out of Barcelona. Wish we stayed there before the cruise as well. It is located across a shopping mall with a Carrefour in it so if you're traveling with family, it's great for getting any needed supplies (water, fruit, snacks, toiletries). There are a number of restaurants to choose from and a good selection of fast food (McDonald's, Subway, Burger King, Pollo Compero). Hotel is close to the port, L'Aquarium,. It's easy to get around in Barcelona. We loved the hop on hop off city bus tour. You can see Sagrada Familia from here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: JPusateri
Reviews.Content: The staff is helpful and pleasent, the roof top pool and leisure area with a bar is supurb! They have an excellent Gym on the roof as well. This was a very comfortable hotel for our 2 night stay after a cruise. We were able to hop on the bus across the street for a great tour of the city and there was excellent dining and shoping all a short walk away. This hotel has spectacular views of the city and port from its roof top area. I thought for a big city the price was reasonable for good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Its a hike!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel520
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was great. Large room, modern amenities, nice breakfast and free wifi but it was quite a long walk to many of Barcelona's famed locations and attractions. If it's your first visit to Barcelona I would recommend staying some where more centrally located. But overall a great hotel for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time, we would certainly go back”
Reviews.Author: hawk9
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very clean and staff extremely helpful. Great location, we used the metro at Glories to get to all tourist sites and used the 10 journeys for just under 8 euros, which made it much cheaper for a family of 4 than the tourist buses. Great shopping and restaurant complex just 2 mins walk from hotel, where we had a couple of really nice meals. Ate at hotel restaurant twice, nice food, reasonable prices but not a huge choice. Hotel pool and sun terrace lovely for the end of a busy day site seeing. A great holiday - no complaints. We had breakfast included, fantastic buffet, we ate well at breakfast and didn't need to have anything until our evening meal

Reviews.Title: “Good experience!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Other than transportation - OK for TAXI but a bit more difficult with public transport - this hotel is good choice. The Barcelona City Tours open bus stops 40 meters away, which can be convenient to some. There is a Mall with great shopping 50 meters away. Great staff, rooms, and the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD STAY BUT ...........”
Reviews.Author: Praline23
Reviews.Content: We were at the barcelona city from May 23 to may 29- We choose this hotel because it was not in the center of the city( downtown is only 4 metro stations) - We wanted a quiet area. The metro station is only at 2 blocks - there is a shopping center across the street with a Carrefour grocery store . Bus and tram are at our door. I read the commentaries on breakfast and honestly this buffet breakfast is one of the best we had in Europe- from cereal, cold cuts- hot meals- fruits, etc... What else can you ask for? We ate two nights at the restaurant -- Food is ok - you definitely can't spend your week there - menu is limited . The only complaint I could do for the neighbourhood is there are no restaurant around ---it is really a business district and in the evening , there is nothing around- Now , my big deception: I MAINLY choose this hotel because there is a pool and I read the commentaries saying that the pool was not opened ---We were at the end of May - temperature is around 28oC and the pool is still not opened-- They are hiring students in the summer to act as a life guard - the pool is probaly 12 feets - ??? - I will definitely wrote a note to Novotel and Air canada vacations- they should put on their websites that Yes there is a pool but opened only 2 months /year !!! - The worst part is that we hesitate between this hotel and their neighbour ( which their pool was opened) but I choose Novotel because of their reputation...Too bad for us ! Of course the pooe beeing closed , the bar of the pool is also closed- probably opened also 2 months/year . I would recommend this hotel if you dont care about a pool !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: gina876
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at the Novotel in Barcelona we thought it was too far away from the main placa - place Catalunya. However we soon discovered it was only 4 metro stops away. The metro operates 24 hours and is packed so doesn't feel creepy travelling on the train late at night. The rooms are very spacious and clean - the hotel seems brand new. I needed a physio when I got here and the hotel staff went out of their way to help me find an english-speaking one close by who turned out to be great. Helped me get rid of my migraine so very appreciative of the service here. The breakfast is absolutely huge - massive buffet of eggs bacon chorizo etc and cereals fruits pastries. Great value for the quality of hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: kakijalan
Reviews.Content: Location a bit further from the centre of attractions, but only 2mins walk to nearest Metro station that will take you directly to Plaza de Catalunya in abt 10mins. The hotel is modern and one of the best feature is the rooftop pool and patio, which affords a gorgeous view of the Agbar Tower and the sea. The rooms are well equipped and modern. Staff are very helpful and friendly. And they've got colourful furniture in the lobby area... in line with the vibrancy of Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “OK - location not great”
Reviews.Author: HertsFamily21 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 2 nights in May over the F1 race weekend, travelled with husband, 2 children aged 5 and 4 and my mum. Although the location of the hotel was excellent for travel to Montmelo for the Formula 1 track (Clot train station is a 5 minute walk from the hotel), it was too far from any of the sights of Barcelona. Therefore we needed to take a taxi whenever we wanted to go to the central city sights or the beach. Another drawback was that the taxis only took 4 passengers and there were 5 of us so we either had to take 2 taxis or wait/book a 7 seater. On the upside, the Metro in Barcelona is excellent, cheap, user friendly and reliable. Buy a T10 card for about 7 Euros for 10 trips anywhere on the Metro and can be used across the whole family! Bargain! The hotel rooms were ok - not what I would classify a 4 star as they are basic (no shower cap, body lotion, iron or ironing board, no choice of pillow type). Also one side of the hotel faces an office block so no view at all. Reception area very nice and modern, with a childrens play area and xbox. The breakfast was really nice, loads of choice, fried eggs, pastries, nespresso coffee machine, and even some spanish breakfast items. Fitness centre was lovely, on top of the building with fab views, great sun trap, a gym, lounge area and pool. Receptionists service could have been better. They didn't have a clue about the F1 race that weekend and didn't offer assistance to find out for us. We had to get on the web to find out where the station was in order to travel there and luckily it was only a 5-10 min walk away. Then on the Saturday evening we noticed some very helpful leaflets on the reception desk detailing the different types of options for travel to the racetrack! Bit late we thought. Our flight home was at 10pm therefore we asked for a late checkout but they were not even interested in finding out for us. The concierge asked a colleague and his response was "No No!" in a very abrupt way, even though we noticed in our room information that family rooms could check out at 5pm. All in all, nice hotel facilities if you like basic rooms, good breakfast but dont mind being away from all the sights and sounds and buzz that is Barcelona. Next time we'll pay more but stay centrally or by the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good base from which to explore a fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: MByrne0141
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very conveniently situated on the Diagonal in Barcelona and so perfect if you want to explore the city. the reception staff were helpful and friendly and spoke English, French, Catalan or Spanish. There is a rooftop swimming pool and bar but both were closed during the afternoon we wanted to use them. The room was simply decorated and perfectly comfortable. There was a bath and a shower. We were disappointed by the buffet. No menu was supplied, only a price and so we had no idea what we would be eating. The starter was varied and tasty but the main course; lamb, pork, lasagne or pizza (not the kind of cuisine I would expect from a French chain) was over-cooked and cold. i would go back to this hotel to stay but would not eat there.

Reviews.Title: “bogdand barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Safty problems - it was not possible to exit on security exit!!! Very dangerous in case of fire! Our room was next to elevator therefore to noisy. The breakferst place it was use is not appreaciable for 4* hotel. The stuf in the hotel was generally kindly and helpful .

Reviews.Title: “Helpful & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ludodl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel for 3 nights beginning of April 2011, it was a pleasant hotel, good value for money, clean, small rooms, very friendly and helpful staff, especially with the children. A small corner for them with toys, playstations and cushions. The breakfast buffet is big with various internal and local food, good quality restaurant and not too expensive. Queues can be big at peak time in the morning or evenings. There is a computer available for free, with printer, perfect for printing your flight boarding pass. Each staff member speak at least 3 langagues, reception quick and efficient. Taxi are waiting outside the hotel, around 8 euros to go to city centre. The hotel is situated next to the Tore Agbar, a metro station, a pharmacy (even open on a sunday...) and a big shopping mall. I was however disappointed with the closure of the swimming pool, it was not advertised on their webiste or at reception. My kids were ready to go but apparently they had no staff available to survey the pool, the guard was only coming a week after.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KathrynLpool
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights with a 5 year old. We were on the 18th floor with great views. Room was very comfortable. Our 5 year old was thrilled with the play area/den in reception. Breakfast was amazing! A really enjoyable stay and would definitely recommend it to anyone travelling to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice we could have made!”
Reviews.Author: AP28
Reviews.Content: We pretty much chose to book at Novotel Barcelona based on the reviews we found here and the good deal we managed to get. Safe to say, we were not disappointed in the least. The hotel was really easy to find from the metro (which is really close by - like a 2 minute walk), and you can see it by looking for the building that resembles London's Gerkin (it;s right next to it). Across from the hotel is actually a shopping complex, which ranges from restaraunts, clothes, computer shops and supermarket (Carre Four). There is plenty here, and worth looking around, though it tends to house the bigger shops - H&M, Zara, Sub-Way etc. Check-in was very easy, and there is a very modern and swanky bar area that you can sit in as well. The receptionists also recommended us going to the top floor - you can get some amazing photos from the terrace, where you can actually see the tops of the Sagrada Familia. It's also worth coming here in the evening to get some unique photos of Barcelona. The rooms are absolutely lovely with a big flat screen tv, and plenty of English channels. The bathroom was also big and clean, though we did find it odd that there was no lock! The only tiny problem we had was that we asked to have our tea selection refilled after this was forgotten by the maid (who cleans daily), and this was actually forgotten by the receptionists. Upon asking again, the different receptionist apologised profusely and fixed this straight away. Like I said, it was a minor problem. The hotel, whilst not in the direct city centre, is very close to the metro, and it takes about 10 mins (or less depending on where you go) to get to the city centre and the main sites. If you've used the Underground in London, you'll be fine with the Metro. At check out, the manager also offered to look after our bags if we wanted to do some last minute sight-seeing, though we didn't take this up. All-in-all we've had a great stay here :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Novotel Hotel. The continental breakfast was fantastic. The hotel was located very close to the subway for easy access to different areas of the city. The hotel did seem to be in a less touristic part of the city, which was both a pro and con.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FaberJ Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Barca at the hotel late in the evening, first thing you is the beautiful Agbar Tower right next door. To make it better, after a day's work in Barcelona you see this view from the roof-top (small) gym. Look at bit to the right and you see the Sagrada Familia as well. All in all, a very clean hotel, with free fast WIFI (great if you are not only there for leisure) and good public transport options. And if you don't want the minibar drinks, there's a supermarket across the street.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: skrooz
Reviews.Content: I actually chose this hotel based on the great Trip Advisor rating. A lot of people rated it high and, I totally agree. The room was a good size for a traveller like me. The breakfast buffet was awesome! They had excellent service. I was impress that they had separate dining areas for families with children and that they have a playroom for kids. The location was great. It was about a block away from the metro station which was quite convenient. I like that it was away from the noise of the city. Also, the free wifi was a tremendous help in keeping in touch with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff- very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: gapyeartradge Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is located slightly away from the city centre, it was a fantastic place to stay and myself and my family thoroughly enjoyed our time there. The views from our window were impressive and the staff were so helpful. It was a shame we couldn't use the swimming pool as it is incredibly picturesque being located on the rooftop. Would thoroughly recommend it. Even the tour bus stops nearby. The only downside would be lack of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a great holiday in Barcelona there are plenty of things to see and do. The Hotel is 5 mins walk from nearest metro station. The rooms were lovely however there was no bath only a shower in the bathroom. It is very easy to find the hotel because of the guerkin shaped building beside it. We did have an issue with bad service the first morning at breakfast but when this was brought to the Manager's attention it was rectified and the service greatly improved.

Reviews.Title: “Great time had in Barca!!!”
Reviews.Author: cicismum
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days with my Husband and 2 sons aged 8 and 11. Had one room on the 8th floor, good size, enough room for all the family. Rooms was very clean, coffee making facilities and great bathroom with shower. Didnt have breakfast so cant comment. Hotel Location was fab for us as didnt want to stay in the centre of Barcelona. The Hotel is very accessible by metro nearest station glories, tram which takes you to the Marina end of Barcelona and the bus, Number 7 goes from outside the hotel to near to placa de catalunya in the centre of Barca. Highly recommend buying a T10 card which means you can make 10 journeys on any mode of transport in the city and more than one family member can use the same card - saves a fortune!!! Opposite the hotel is a shopping centre containing a Carrefour were we bought food for lunch and drinks for in the room. There are restaurants and fast food places within the complex also. We would recommend Kurt and Gut for breakfast and evening meal and Farggi makes nice crepes and waffles!!! Any qquestions please ask.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: EakPhanunan
Reviews.Content: + We can checkin earlier at 11AM. That's wonderful for a guest that was just arrived by 15-hour flight. I could change my dress, take a shower and prepare for the upcoming meeting without having to do that in the lobby like before. + Location is great. Very close to metro station Glories. Opposite is a large shopping complex with Carrefour that you could stock your drinks/foods for the night. + Room is very clean and brand-new. I see no black spot or stain in the bathroom at all. Additional sofa bed is comfortable too. - Breakfast is the same every morning. But you should choose it anyway, as there's no convenience store in this city.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good food, good staff, excellent position in town, safe and clean parking

Reviews.Title: “All in order (goods/services) as expected!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I used accorhotels.com to find and book a hotel at Barcelona, finally choosing Novotel Barcelona city. Staying at this hotel covered all expectations from check-in to check out!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel and would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff were professional and very helpful. Location was excellent - close to the Metro. Had a lovely view of the Akbar tower. Having Carrefour and Zara opposite the road adds to appeal...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: AFDerrick
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We decided to stay here an additional night and the hotel staff was more than accomodating. The view from the roof was incredible unfortunately we did not notice it until our last night there. The breakfast was incredible. It was a little far from the subway but not too bad and right next to one of the sights of Barcelona, a big bullet shaped building that lights up at night. Would stay here again if I go back.

Reviews.Title: “More than expectation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: New, modern hotel. Friendly staff, always forthcoming & eager to help. Clean, comfortable rooms, well lit & good amenities. Well located with restaurants & shopping at doorstep. Above average & exceeded my expectations. Would recommend for both business & holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located Novotel Hotel for Awesome Barcelona!!”
Reviews.Author: osasako Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Gloria station with easy connection to Clot and into La Rambla. Fantastic shopping centre just across the road at Glories with Spanish fashion chains like Zara, Massimo Dutti, Mango, Berskhka and Pull and Bear. Free Wi-fi in the hotel, free use of computers. Excellent standard as always from a Novotel hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: strudledoodle
Reviews.Content: I had 4 rooms booked for 9 nights and had made the booking 11months previously upon arrival I was informed that payment hadnt been taken from my card and would have to pay again,this was almost £3000 and as I called my card company they confirmed payment had been made in sept 2009 but as the hotel was delayed in opening the payment was lying dormant. Luckily I had enough spare credit and after 2 days of argueing I reluctantly repaid (claimed it back once home and Accor managed to trace original payment) My concern was what would have happened if I hadnt had the spare credit was with 8 adults and 4 children we would have been stuck in Barca with no where to stay so please please confirm with hotel prior to travelling that you have actually paid. Other than that the hotel itself was good,rooms quite small for families but big enough for a couple. Bathroom was lovely,huge shower and lots of space for toiletries. Windows in the room were floor to celing and had a great blackout blind. Breakfast in the bar area is great value 2.50euros for coffee and a pastry and kids eat free! it was so good we didnt bother with even trying the buffet breakfast, Pool is on the roof with stunning views across Barca right over to Montjuic and all across the sea front and right back to the gothic cathederal. Metro is only 200meters away and cheap as chips,we got the family pass with 70trips and still had spare when we left. there is also a tram that goes to the beach and right down avenue diagonal(pass can be used on that as well) there is free internet in the lobby which was great and also free wifi through out hotel. we ate in the main restaurant on our last nighth and had the set menu which was fantastic value we wished we had tried it earlier in our stay. There is a shopping centre across the road with a huge carrefour and having a decent fridge in the room we stocked up and all sorts of stuff. After the arguments over payment we found the reception staff were rather rude to us for the rest of the stay as they would do everything possible to not speak to us. House keeping staff were great altho 3 days the room was not cleaned by 5pm and we had to request it to be cleaned earlier. overall great location and good hotel but the reception staff need training in customer service and hopefully they have sorted out any further issues regarding payments

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Hennyreinhardt
Reviews.Content: We were family with 2 children, got a room in 10th floor. Negative : The room was smell (smoke) even we asked for a no smoking room and the sofabed was painfull. In the receptionist there were only 2 people to serve many guests in long queue. Positive : Located in central city, easy to get public transport, and opposites is a huge shooping centre. Very nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “great value for price”
Reviews.Author: asmeeth
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our stay at this Novotel. The staff at the reception was friendly and helpfull, and the rooms are modern and clean. We would definitely stay here again. From the airport we took the train/metro (train to Clot/metro to Glories) on a T-10 ticket (7.95 Euro) for the 4 of us, with 6 tickets to spare !!! The shopping mall across the street has lots of shops, a large supermarket and several restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel....”
Reviews.Author: bmalhado
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with very good localization near the metro...

Reviews.Title: “Shame about paper cups and coffee supply”
Reviews.Author: BobbyS_11 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a good(could be great hotel) easy to get to from Glories Metro (MAX 5MINS) easy to all areas massive shopping complex across the road ideal for the wife while I was doing other things.(Sleeping)METRO is so easy T10 ticket MAKES TRAVELLING so simple in BARCA 1.60 EURO from airport to hotel and 5mins later than the taxi other people took 30e with tip.I WOULD STAY AGAIN NO PROBLEM AT THE RIGHT PRICE,we paid 55e per night for this it was a superb hotel.Bobby S PLYMOUTH

Reviews.Title: “Could be Faulty Towers in Spain!”
Reviews.Author: mansmanreality
Reviews.Content: So we knew a lot about Novotel as the old brnad was appauling but the new design hotels have a lot to offer. Or so we thought. We had stayed previously at Novotel in the City of London and had a wonderfully quiet and relaxing overnight stay. The rooms standards were so much higher than the old room stock and the mattress, pillow and bedding offerings were fantsastic. Barcelona City was the opposite! Having booked we contacted the hotel by emailto understand a little bit more about how to get to the location. No real help was provided except they copied the confusing information form the internet that we had already seen. We email the hotel 3 days before our outbound flight to ask about early check in and late check out. They only responded after a reminder email on the evening before the flight and expecting us to pay 50% of the rate for the early arrival and 50% of the late stay. A real rip off. We flew at 0625! At check in we were 'told' that we need to sign a security form that was not in English and the receptionsit who wore a badge showing that she spoke English - though couldnt - could not explain what this was for. Apparently it is a police requirement though heaven knows why they cant have a translated version of it to assist guests who dont usually sign without understanding a legal document. This hotel boasts free high speed wifi internet in the room though this wasnt working and the external 'support' department were unavailable to resolve the issues. SO Room 1 had no internet and no bath. Room 2 had no internet and a broken sink Room 3 - this is when we started to take pictures - was apparently a suite, had no internet, smelt of damp and had a big leak coming through the bathroom ceiling Room 4 had no internet and the aircon was broken. This room also had 'fudge' stains to the toilet floor, a broken bath mixer tap, electrical lighting cabling hanging from the bathroom mirror and 'residue' stains to the toilet walls. Look at our pictures. Ironically at check out they did not suggest a discount of any kind until I impressed on the front office manager that we would not be paying the full bill. I thought this was a real cheek. There were 2 things to praise though. Again the bedding and mattress. The best I have found anywhere and the breakfast offering. Though noone paid any attenion to any of the guests needs at breakfest the offering was great. Surprisingly i paid the only compliment at check out to the breakfast offering and it was immediately refunded! It strike us that this hotel is very badly run, most staff (a couple were really lovely) have an appauling attitude, the general manager was always 'unavailable' and there is a noticable absence of any satisfactory maintenance program. Couple this with the rather arrogant suggestion that you would pay an extra 50% of a daily rate to stay and extra 2 hours it surely means a place to avoid....................... Shame really because if this hotel have the managers it needed, the right attitude and the honesty to respect its guests it could be a great place to stay. Our advice, unless you want an argument, attitude, lack of attention and a restless stay, your money it better spent elsewhere. Enjoy Barcelona! Having b

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a little far from the city center”
Reviews.Author: Traveller12311
Reviews.Content: Nice new hotel, nice rooms and good service. However the hotel was a bit far from the city and not entirely in the best area. Very nice rooftop pool!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Alexhell77 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine. One room service dude was not able to speak English but the rest of the personal did good. Internet in the room is wireless and with password. No cable. With all these, nothing to complain. Relaxing and pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: Teresa055
Reviews.Content: Maybe not the greatest location. There is a good mall nearby and the metro isn't too far. You don't really get an authentic Barcelona feel in the area. However, it is a very good value for the nice new room. It had more amenities then any other European hotel we stayed in during our trip. It had instant coffee and a tea kettle which was rare on our trip. The roof top pool was a plus since we were there in the summer. The views are amazing. The negative which previous views have stated are the long elevator wait times...which I think is pretty minor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackjerko Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: found hotel quite close to trams and metro also very conveient to city centre attractions

Reviews.Title: “not a novotel as I know”
Reviews.Author: Ammori Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: first, the idea of saving mony by not hiring a bill boy to carry customers luggage is giving a bad impression of what the service would be. second, there was no clothes cabin in the room, only a bar next to the room door to hang the clothes on which make my room always messy. I like the idea of free internet and the bar and reciption employees are perfect. I recommend fixing hose of water next to the cabinet in WC belive me its good idea.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel. Good location for shopping, seeing the sights & business. As there are good restaurents near by probably best not to eat in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: asbarreto
Reviews.Content: Rooms are comfortable and new. The view from our room was amazing (18th floor). It is not near the main tourist attractions, but there is a metro station really near, so it is not a problem. There is also a great commercial center in front of the hotel, with lots of restaurants, movies and also a supermarket. There are several breakfast options, but i don´t recommend since they can all be considered expensive. A much better option is to have your breakfast at the commercial center. I had some problems with the room service too, because they simply didnt answer the phone. The pool on the terrace was also not avaibale. Free internet was great. So, its not perfect, but its ok.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The only problem we experienced was locating the hotel - not yet on my navigator and no sign at street level so we drove past it twice. Excellent room, friendly staff, good food. A good walk from the city centre - great for the tram and metro. Will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service, Maintenance- a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Leandraky
Reviews.Content: I wasn't going to publish a review until I heard back from Novotel HQ (it would only be fair to share their professional response as well) but to my surprise I didn't receive a response, so I figured I'd share my letter to HQ without a satisfactory response and announce that without a reply we have decided never to stay in a Novotel property again. We just returned from our short stay at Novotel Barcelona City and I would like to bring to your attention our dissatisfactory experience. Upon our late night arrival, we were greeted by a kind gentleman at front desk. He acknowledged our anniversary and that our room had a nice view of the city. When we arrived to our room on the 17th floor our door would not open, we had to go back down and request assistance to which someone from the engineering dept. assisted with the jammed door. In preparation for bed after a long day of travel, we noticed the bathroom sink drain was clogged and left a dirty residue. We did not report this immediately; we just wanted to go to bed. In the morning beginning at 9am and every thirty minutes thereafter, our slumber was interrupted by housekeeping barging into our room twice without knocking . We put the Do Not Disturb sign on the door and the third and fourth time they did knock before invading. By then we decided to get up and leave to allow your housekeeping to clean as our patience (and housekeeping's) were running thin. In the rush, we did not report our clogged sink which remained clogged for the rest of the day. After a long day of touring the city, we returned from our ventures and requested a late check out. The late check out was kindly granted until 2:00pm. We enjoyed our early morning site-seeing and returned to our hotel room at 1:30pm for a quick shower and to retrieve our things. A housekeeper greeted us in our room with “You were supposed to check out today.” I explained to her we had a late check out at 2:00pm. She left all her things in our room and left to investigate this herself. Waiting for her to return, we ended up removing her cleaning trolley from our room to shut the door. Promptly at 2:04pm as we were about to leave feeling angry and agitated from the constant interruptions during our anniversary weekend, we were once again summoned to the door by your housekeeping staff requesting our departure. The sink remained clogged. A minor problem such as a clogged sink, a jammed door, or an accidental invasion by housekeeping is unfortunately quite common when traveling, however we resided in your hotel for less than 48 hours and we experienced all of this problems, the last being of highest severity. The likelihood that we will recommend a Novotel property after our weekend is extremely unlikely. I hope to hear a response from management in regards to our weekend stay. Residing in North America, I've heard of this hotel chain before and from online reviews I expected more from Novotel; not only do we read these reviews, we also contribute our own. I look forward to hearing from you, And P.S Tripadvior, the pool was disgusting and dirty with litter and sludge floating on the top.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Novotel Barcelona City”
Reviews.Author: mjcmoppel
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights on a leisure break with wife and teenage daughter. Staff were very friendly and helpful - maps, transport, wifi code for my daughter's iphone etc. Great views from the hotel and a very good quality breakfast. Opened in April 2010, the hotel is really nice and in a good location for the Noblenou Rambla nearby which is a nice area for a drink and meal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: unspecified
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is the rooms and decor. You're greeted with a very pleasant, modern lobby and the rooms are just as pleasant. Huge room with sofa, desk, king size bed, tea making facilities and lots of space. The bathroom is also huge and well-furnished, and everything is spotlessly clean. A really nice environment for resting - being a business district it is very peaceful at night, too. There are a few small negatives, however: the location isn't great, it's just a little bit far out of town, although the metro is reasonably close by and the Sagrada Familia is within easy walking distance. The breakfast buffet is not good value for the money - the selection is surprisingly poor, although the Novotel offers a cheap "express" breakfast at the bar which is much better value. Finally, the Internet connection is very slow (but at least it's free). All in all, however, this is an excellent hotel and I'd have no concerns about recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with High price”
Reviews.Author: sayuri399 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: At first side, you will like hotel. But, inside everything in the room is broken or dirty. There is a noise, when you try to move in the bed. Carpet and sheets are dirty. No slipper. There is just one small window with apartment side, so there is really small amount of sun light at the room. Moreover during check-in, I came like 11 am at the hotel. I told them I had indirect flight, and did not sleep at night. But, they did not make an favor and give my room like 2 pm. Although there is no need of payment during check-in, they want me to do payment to get the room!! (I did my reservation with credit card, so they have guaranty). Breakfast is not suitable for a vegetarian. They just have variety of sausage. small amount of cheese and other products. no olives in barcelona!! The only thing that I loved about hotel is location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and transport links”
Reviews.Author: Bmena
Reviews.Content: It is easy to get from Barcelona airport to Clot Arago station. It is then only one metro stop back to Glories Metro which is an easy walk from the Novotel. The cheapest way to do this is on a T-10 ticket which will also work for the tram outside the hotel to go to the beach. Our room was clean and spacious and with a cracker view of Torre Agar. For the price we paid the value was superb. Check in and out were both effeciently completed and reception staff were pleasant any time we spoke to them. As a very light sleeper I was delighted with how quiet and well sound proofed our room was and the air conditioning was the quietest I have come across. The only negative was the bad smells near the lifts at reception and on the roof. Even allowing for Spanish drains this was off putting. It is worth noting the pool is seasonal only and was closed when we were there..

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location - recommended”
Reviews.Author: nicksys
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Novotel Barcelona City having booked it at best price on laterooms.com. Arrived at 12 as advised for 1 night as cruising the next day. The room wasnt ready but they v happily help luggage till later. Although not ideal - the service was good. 15 min walk to sagrida familia and the metro and tram are v close by - esp the metro! The room itself was excellent, roomy and 4star quality. The piece de resistence is the pool and views and bar on the top floor - wow! 270 degree views of the city and most importantly the sea, harbour, familla sagrida. When walking out and about - look for the 'torpedo' building that is lit up at night - its next to the hotel so helps with navigation! Didnt use the restaurant or breakfast facility but the kids liked the free internet. The lobby area also was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helgi60
Reviews.Content: It's been a while since I've stayed at a Novotel. I liked it then and I liked it now. The hotel is very nice and clean, the service excellent, the room perfect. Everything in good working order. The service at the restaurant was a bit slow the only time I dined there, but the breakfast was excellent. The location is not bad as there are plenty of shops and restaurants just across the street and the subway station is not far away. I hadn't meant to stay at the Novotel, but there was no room at the neighbouring Ibis, so I decided to upgrade. I don't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Good brand new hotel, but free internet access not fast enough for VPN connections”
Reviews.Author: RBRSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel recently and they have free internet access (Wi-Fi). If you are going to use only the internet, the speed of connection is fast enough. On the other hand, if you need to establish a VPN connection with your company, the speed of connection is quite slow. I requested a faster connection option (even if it was necessary to pay), but they did not have it. My suggestion to the hotel is that they look for this alternative, otherwise, business people may prefer other hotels. I would not stay there again if a faster connection does not become available. Good facts about this hotel: restaurant (fantastic food !!), cleanliness, new Points to improve: internet connection speed, add a curtain or a door to the box (otherwise, water from the shower spills out of the box - as it does not have a door).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to visit Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: MarcRoy
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Novotel Barcelona City was great. Below are my pros and cons of this hotel. Pros: - Price: good value for the price we paid (approx 130 euros per night) - Brand new hotel with nice rooms - Shopping mall accross the street with supermarket and plenty of restaurants - Nice pool on the top floor - FREE WIFI!! - The Clavaria restaurant in the hotel is actually quite good! - The hotel is one block away from Torre Agbar (see pics) Cons: - To visit Barcelona, you will need to take the Metro station every time but Playa Catalunya is just 3 stops away. - Modern rooms but not practical..no alarm clock, AC plug in the bathroom... - Service is just ok. Small details like no printer working in all 3 internet stations. And don't start with special requests....you can gorget it... I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to visit Barcelona but does not want to pay high prices asked for Las Ramblas district.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Handy Location, Good Facilities but Service could be better”
Reviews.Author: MattyB93
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a week for me and my family (Wife and two children 7yrs and 9yrs) we had visited Barcelona before so knew roughly the location. It is a little out of the main area but is only a long walk or five minutes on the metro or tram, there are stations for both just outside. That said there are of plenty of things nearby (resturants, a shopping mall). The hotel is a typical 'chain' hotel which is fine as you know what to expect at the price you pay (lets be honest you can pick these type of hotels up for a decent price if you book indvance) The place was clean, modern and had what you expect, however the really plus point was the roof top swimming pool, terrace and gym. This was great and meant we could chill out by the pool before going sight seeing, this is great if you have kids of any age. The views from the pool are great too, you can see pretty much all of the city and the sea. The area around the hotel is very modern and alot of development is going on so there is building work going on, although this didn't impact on us at all. The downsides are the service is a little disapointing, we had to keep asking for things like an extra pillow (several calls and trips to reception) and on our last day we had to que for 20 minutes to get breakfast (prior to this they had two area's for breakfast on the ground floor and lower ground) but for some reason they closed the lower one on our last day. So in all it is generally good and I would go back, but if you are very demanding and expect things when you click your fingers give it a miss (or chill out a bit and think about how much you have paid)

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect city hotel”
Reviews.Author: ifd
Reviews.Content: Just perfect city hotel. Great location, very easy to go around the city as there are tram and metro stations and the tourist buses are passing just in front of the hotel the whole day and there is a big shopping centre just opossite the hotel. We had a wonderful view of the city as we stayed at the 16th floor. Fantastic roof garden with restaurant and pool.The restaurant at the ground floor was very good and the breadfast also.The receptionists were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but beware with the pickpockets”
Reviews.Author: LisbonTravel
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and a good service, but pay very atention to the pickpockets at the Glòries metro station and at the Glòries comercial center. The city of Barcelona it is not handling very well with the pickpockets problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money”
Reviews.Author: DonaldG_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my wife and daughter aged 9. This is a new hotel and is spacious, modern and clean. Our room was on the 17th floor was equipped with flat screen tv, minibar, large bed (also a sofa bed), air conditioning, electric blinds and a speaker system in the bathroom - so you could listen to tv while in the toilet! The public areas are very nice, comfotable chairs and sofas in reception, free internet terminals, a kids play area plus the rooftop bar and pool was very plush and offered great views of the city. The location is not within walking distance of any tourist spots or near a Bus Turistic stop, however a Metro station is only 5 minutes walk away which is on the line for Placa Cataluna and Placa Espayna. There is a shopping mall across the road, which is handy for fast food outlets and the supermarket for other essentials. Taxi fare were 40 Euros to the Airport and 20 Euros from the Cruise Terminal. Minus points - reception was always busy, so checking in and out took a while. Staff although friendly seemed a bit disorganised. Also the hotel rooms are on Floors 7 to 18, and there is only 3 smallish lifts - sometimes it took a while to wait on an empty elevator - especially if you were carrying suitcases. Overall for what we paid (100 euro per night), this hotel represented excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: booLisbon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Novotel Barcelona City for 5 nights with my husband and children (10 and 5). Good price, children didn't pay. A good buffet breakfast included on the rate. Free internet. Amusement areas for children. Pool in the roof with an outstanding view over Barcelona, very secure. jaccuzi was being repaired. We went and visited Barcelona by car, marvelous GPS ;-) the hotel was well located, always a free parking place in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “good location for metro & bus but not within walking distance of most tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: bbeerbower
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to Barcelona for vacation. I love this city as it is so full of life and so much to see. My most recent stay was June 2010 with my extended family of 10 including children ages 10-14. We stayed here 4 days prior to going on a cruise. Barcelona is a city that seems to fill all of its rooms on the weekends so if you are planning a trip to Barcelona on the weekend, I'd reserve your hotel well in advance. The Novotel Barcelona City is a fairly new hotel in a good location. There is an older mall across the street with average restaurants, Starbucks and a grocery store (lower level with dept store upper level). The entire area is being renovated. The metro is 2 blocks-there is major road construction @ Glories on the way to metro. There is a bus stop across from hotel. I ate an evening meal at the hotel restaurant which was quite good and reasonably priced. Breakfast was expensive so I elected to eat at the mall. Rooms were clean & beds comfortable. There is an enclosed pool on top floor with a nice city view which the children enjoyed. The service at this hotel is below average for a business hotel. Novotel usually has fairly good business hotels but this one lacked the expected service. Check in and out was slow and the staff seemed very confused. Even though the staff spoke English, I felt that they really didn't understand what I was saying. There were many different nationalities and I got the impression that they didn't understand each other either. Maybe because this hotel just opened, but there seemed to be a noticible problem with the service and with employees knowing their jobs. The rates were good and this was one of the few hotels that had family rooms that could accommodate our large party near the city center. The other hotel we stayed in was the Hilton Diagonal Mar which was also a very nice hotel but further away from the city center near the beach. It was also more expensive. bbeerbower

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms but bad service”
Reviews.Author: Fish0072
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Barcelona City for 3 nights on holiday through Spain. As the hotel is new the facilities and rooms were of a good standard and comfortable. The main problem we experienced was the level of service at the hotel, whether this is due to poorly trained staff (as the hotel is new) or other reasons, it was disappointing as the hotel is a great product and I am the type of traveler that would rate good service over the amenity and 'newness' of a room. While breakfast was included in our rate it was quite frankly, a joke. The staff on arrival were very dis-organised and on one morning had to line up for 20 minutes just to be seated! We thought this was because the hotel was very busy and there were not enough tables, but once we did get into the dining area a number of tables were empty or just not cleared which reflected poorly managed and trained staff in clearing the tables and the staff in seating the guests. Once we did get seated there was no offer of tea or coffee and on most occasions had to request it myself. The food also was very average. On check in we were offered no information either about the hotel facilities or Barcelona itself, the reception staff equally seemed very badly managed and trained, this included most nights returning to the hotel and not even being greeted by reception staff (some of which preferred to stand next to the main door smoking) Don't they realise how bad this looks for your hotel? At the time we stayed and as it is a Novotel feature they were offering great rates for families and children so this resulted in lots of children! So got a bit tiring dealing with kids playing in lifts, running through the lobby and pushing you out of the way at breakfast. So if you want a hotel that doesn't value service I would recommend this otherwise stay away! Lift your game Novotel, I stay in many hotels across the world and a friendly smile and simple greetings and good service go a long way above groovy furnishings in a great stay for your guests!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality”
Reviews.Author: AnitaBrazil
Reviews.Content: It's pretty standard Novotel, i.e. you'll find there what you expect of a Novotel. The location might not be the best for tourists, as it isn't that central, but it is very easy to reach other areas through subway (L1) or cab (which is very cheap in Barcelona). The rooms are spacious and clean, the bed is comfortable. The breakfest is good, although nothing special - if not part of the rate I'd suggest going to Starbucks in Les Glories (mall across the street) or at the bar, but not taking the buffet. On the 19th floor they have a bar, fitness and swimming pool. It is a very small swimming pool and the bar could be better, taking the advantage of the wonderful view.

Reviews.Title: “"One of the best hotels I've ever been"”
Reviews.Author: ippok
Reviews.Content: I spent three days in this modern hotel with my family, and everything was perfect. Large room and bathroom, clean hotel, good service, kind people. Also, very good and varied breakfast: Variety of coffee, fruits, sweets etc. certainly deserve more than 15 euros for it. Best value for money......

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable hotel - but a bit far from the fun parts of the city!”
Reviews.Author: NSethi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a new part of town, so it's a little far from the fun parts of the city. We didn't head to a club or a bar at times as we got too lazy to walk some distance to take the metro. The rooms are nice, they gave us one on the 18th floor with a great view of the city, but the service is so-so. Also, the breakfast is avoidable.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dartmouthgirl
Reviews.Content: We spent two great nights at the Novotel Barcelona City in June, before embarking on a cruise. The hotel just opened in March/10 so there weren't many reviewes when we booked but we got a great rate. What a wonderfully pleasant surprise. The hotel is positioned as a business hotel, but is quite family-friendly. We had a triple room: a queen-sized bed plus fold-out couch for our daughter who is six. Breakfast at the bar was 3 euros for a coffee and pastry. Free internet in the lobby + free wireless in the room (slow, but free). Best feature: an incredible rooftop pool and bar with stunning views over Barcelona. Incredible. The pool wasn't listed on the hotel website when we booked, so perhaps it's new. The room had English TV channels, a minbar and great tub. Location is great: on the Avenida Diagonal within 3 minutes walk of the Glories subway station. It's also across the street from a tram stop AND a shopping mall. There's a Carrefour grocery store in the mall: great place to grab a baguette and bottle of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Pat-DL
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in hotel, 2 adults and 2 kids (11 & 9) in a family room. Found it difficult to get hotel in Barcelona that would easily cater for 2+2 in one room and was very happy with the Novotel city. Second bed was a sofa fold-out that was fine for the kids. Room was very comfortable and quiet - the power shower was brilliant! . Breakfast was excellent - lots of choice of pastries, fruit, and a cook to do eggs whatever ever way you wanted. We ate dinner in the restaurant one night and found it to be Top Rate, and much better vakue than the places we ate at La Ramblas. Close to the restaurant is a little playroom with a few toys for young kids and a couple of X-boxes for the older ones - small touch but kept ours happy while we finished our meal. Is a new hotel, which has pros and cons - very clean, top floor looks great though pool wasn't open till end May. Some of the staff a bit clueless, but all were good natured and helpful. Main hiccup was when we got stuck in the lift for 10 mins, but help was at hand quickly and of course the cultural hotspots of Barcelina were forgotten when our kids phoned home - "we got stuck in a lift!" seems to be the highlight of the trip for them. Location is beside the Torre Agbar (Gherkin tower) which meant it is easily located from pretty much anywh isere in the city. We got a taxi direct from Barca airport which cost €35 (€10 of which was for 3 bags). It is a 5 min walk from Glories metro station, where we never had to wait more than 3 minutes to catch a train. Across the road from a large shopping centre with plenty of shops and restaurants. Quieter location than La Ramblas, no sense of atmosphere around the streets (and less chance of pockets picked). Overall, delighted with the hotel - would definitely stay there again next time, whether on our own or with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay...”
Reviews.Author: Narathip
Reviews.Content: It's one of the new nice clean and smart 4 stars hotels in Barcelona. The hotel location is a little out of Barcelona centre like La Rambla and Catalunya Square, but within easy reach of the metro (L1 (Red Line) Glories Station) back to the centre. They also have a nice restaurant serving breakfast, lunch and dinner for the reasonable price and just opposite the hotel is a big shopping centre and supermarket which is really convenient. We really recommend this Novotel Hotel for a short break in Barcelona to everyone.
